p: Among the cellular models, primary human myoblasts represent an appropriate model for the study of mechanisms involved in the pathogenesis of myositis. Myoblasts infected with CHIKV [ 94] were compared by transcriptomic analyses with non-infected cells; this study suggests the critical function of genes related with apoptosis, innate immunity, and inflammation, that could play a role during viral replication and thus affecting the clinical outcome [ 94].
